intro: Packera sanguisorboides, commonly known as the red sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
